snippet: Yaroslava Shvedova, ranked 65th in the world, won a Golden Set, putting the ball into play 44 times without losing a point, in her victory over 10th-seeded Sara Errani.
abstract: Yaroslava Shvedova, ranked world's 65th in women's tennis, achieves a Golden Set--one that is won without losing a single point--in the third round at Wimbledon; defeats 10th-seeded Sara Errani; other tournament results noted.
lead_paragraph: Yaroslava Shvedova, ranked 65th in the world, won a Golden Set, putting the ball into play 44 times without losing a point, in her victory over 10th-seeded Sara Errani.

headline.seo: Wimbledon 2012 — Shvedova of Kazakhstan Plays Perfect Set in Victory
headline.main: The Perfect Set Is No Myth in the Women’s Third Round at Wimbledon
headline.print_headline: The Perfect Set Is No Myth in the Women’s Third Round at Wimbledon
